speaker: Emma
text: Alright team, let’s go over the launch timeline. By the end of this sprint, we will have finished the core implementation, right?
ipa: ɔlˈraɪt tiːm | lɛts ɡoʊ ˈoʊvɚ ðə lɑnʧ ˈtaɪmlaɪn | baɪ ði ɛnd əv ðɪs sprɪnt | wi wɪl həv ˈfɪnɪʃt ðə kɔr ˌɪmpləmɛnˈteɪʃən | raɪt
stress: ALRIGHT TEAM | LET’S GO OVER THE LAUNCH TIMELINE | BY THE END OF THIS SPRINT | WE WILL HAVE FINISHED THE CORE IMPLEMENTATION | RIGHT?
linking:
"go over" → /ɡoʊ ˈoʊvɚ/ (smooth connection)
"will have" → /wɪl həv/ (have reduced)
"finished the" → /ˈfɪnɪʃt ðə/ (T links to article)

speaker: You
text: Yep, we are wrapping up the final unit tests today. The CI/CD pipeline is going to be updated tomorrow to include staging deployments.

stress: YEP | WE ARE WRAPPING UP THE FINAL UNIT TESTS TODAY | THE CI/CD PIPELINE IS GOING TO BE UPDATED TOMORROW TO INCLUDE STAGING DEPLOYMENTS

speaker: Emma
text: Perfect. What about the new dashboard features?

speaker: You
text: Kevin is working on them right now. He is going to finalize the UI by Friday, and then QA will be testing it over the weekend.

speaker: Emma
text: Nice. So by Monday, we should have everything in place to start internal reviews.

speaker: You
text: Exactly. If nothing breaks, we will be ready for release by next Thursday.
